author: cnbc.com
title: Sentar Awarded $15B Alliant 2 Small Business Government Wide Acquisition Contract (GWAC) Vehicle
text:
Sentar selected by GSA on the small business track of a 10-year, $15 billion GWAC delivering information technology platforms and services to federal agencies
HUNTSVILLE, Ala.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Sentar, Inc. (Sentar), a Women-Owned Small Business, announced today it has been selected by the General Services Administration (GSA) for the 10-year, $15 billion Alliant 2 Small Business (Alliant 2 SB) Government Wide Acquisition Contract (GWAC). Alliant 2 SB GWAC is a Multiple Award, Indefinite-Delivery/Indefinite-Quantity (IDIQ) that enables federal government agencies to purchase information technology platforms and professional services.
Alliant 2 SB is a follow-on to the $15 billion Alliant Small Business contract, which was awarded in February 2009. The Alliant 2 SB GWAC has been closely reviewed and revised to make sure that it is as successful as its predecessor, Alliant Small Business.
“The Alliant 2 Small Business contract provides exposure of our cybersecurity expertise to a broader set of Government agencies allowing us the flexibility to develop, integrate and deliver innovative solutions that meet our customers’ evolving mission needs,” said Bridget Abashian, CEO and President of Sentar. “We are excited about this award and the possibilities it presents for Sentar.”
Named the government’s best-in-class solution for comprehensive information technology services by the Office of Management & Budget, the Alliant 2 SB master contract’s scope covers cybersecurity, critical infrastructure and information assurance, IT services for healthcare, IT operations and maintenance, modeling and simulation, mobile security, cloud computing, big data, digital government, open-source integration, internet of things, enterprise resource planning, web services, web hosting and analytics, software development, virtualization, network infrastructure and operations, 3D printing integration, data center consolidation and related IT services.
About Sentar, Inc.
Founded in 1990, Sentar is a Women-Owned Small Business (WOSB) providing advanced cybersecurity and Intel solutions and services that empower customers to securely leverage computing and network assets to their fullest potential. Almost one third of Sentar employees are U.S. Veterans. Sentar’s innovative cybersecurity technologies protect network and host computer resources from cyber attackers and malicious insiders. Sentar has offices in Huntsville, Alabama; Charleston, South Carolina; and Columbia, Maryland. For more information, visit www.sentar.com .
